body_html:
I like the thing in older version that when typing a tensor in debugger, it shows the size(shape) of the tensor. Sadly, this feature is no longer in 0.40. Actually most of time, what I worry is whether the tensor shape is what I want. Now I must type tensor.shape, which is tedious.
Here is an example in 0.40
...,
[ -65.2422, -52.2383, -35.8047, ..., 0.5691,
22.1797, 5.3984],
[ -65.2422, -52.2383, -35.8047, ..., 0.5691,
22.1797, 5.3984],
[ -65.2422, -52.2383, -35.8047, ..., 0.5691,
22.1797, 5.3984]]], dtype=torch.float64, device='cuda:0') I hope tensor size is also list here!!!
body_text:
I like the thing in older version that when typing a tensor in debugger, it shows the size(shape) of the tensor. Sadly, this feature is no longer in 0.40. Actually most of time, what I worry is whether the tensor shape is what I want. Now I must type tensor.shape, which is tedious.
Here is an example in 0.40
...,
[ -65.2422,  -52.2383,  -35.8047,  ...,    0.5691,
22.1797,    5.3984],
[ -65.2422,  -52.2383,  -35.8047,  ...,    0.5691,
22.1797,    5.3984],
[ -65.2422,  -52.2383,  -35.8047,  ...,    0.5691,
22.1797,    5.3984]]], dtype=torch.float64, device='cuda:0')  I hope tensor size is also list here!!!
body:
I like the thing in older version that when typing a tensor in debugger, it shows the size(shape) of the tensor. Sadly, this feature is no longer in 0.40. Actually most of time, what I worry is whether the tensor shape is what I want. Now I must type tensor.shape, which is tedious.
Here is an example in 0.40
...,
         [ -65.2422,  -52.2383,  -35.8047,  ...,    0.5691,
            22.1797,    5.3984],
         [ -65.2422,  -52.2383,  -35.8047,  ...,    0.5691,
            22.1797,    5.3984],
         [ -65.2422,  -52.2383,  -35.8047,  ...,    0.5691,
            22.1797,    5.3984]]], dtype=torch.float64, device='cuda:0')  I hope tensor size is also list here!!!
